title: How to Make Lemon and Coriander Hummus

steps.headline: Place a sieve over a bowl and pour the can of chickpeas into the sieve.
steps.description: Allow the liquid to drain into the bowl.

steps.headline: Put the drained chickpeas into the blender.
Pour half a teaspoon of olive oil into the blender.
Spoon in three tablespoons of tahini paste into the blender.
Add in a pinch of salt.
steps.description: You don't necessarily need to add in salt but it is recommended.

steps.headline: Squeeze one lemon.
steps.description: Pour the juice of the lemon into the blender filtering out the seeds.

steps.headline: Pour in a tablespoon of the liquid from the chickpeas.
Put the lid on the blender and use the pulse setting to blend the ingredients.
Add a little bit more of the chickpea liquid gradually until the mixture is smooth.
Empty the contents of the blender into a serving dish and garnish with fresh coriander.
Serve with pitta bread, falafel, breadsticks, carrots, cucumber or anything else you feel would go well with hummus.

text: Place a sieve over a bowl and pour the can of chickpeas into the sieve. Allow the liquid to drain into the bowl. Put the drained chickpeas into the blender.  Pour half a teaspoon of olive oil into the blender.  Spoon in three tablespoons of tahini paste into the blender.  Add in a pinch of salt. You don't necessarily need to add in salt but it is recommended. Squeeze one lemon. Pour the juice of the lemon into the blender filtering out the seeds. Add coriander to the blender.  Pour in a tablespoon of the liquid from the chickpeas.  Put the lid on the blender and use the pulse setting to blend the ingredients.  Add a little bit more of the chickpea liquid gradually until the mixture is smooth.  Empty the contents of the blender into a serving dish and garnish with fresh coriander.  Serve with pitta bread, falafel, breadsticks, carrots, cucumber or anything else you feel would go well with hummus.
